ygData.subject: Re: The Man (?) Behind the Curtain
ygData.msgSnippet: ... The name was on my list, seemed to fit a bard, and sounded female, so the character ended up female.  Like I said, I hadn t intended it to be my main
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 20 May 1999, Bob Stewart wrote:
>
> At 11:53 AM 5/20/99 -0400, John Kim wrote:
> >Wood elf female. Doubt it was me, I was in Oasis last night.
>
> Do you often wonder who's behind the character you see on the screen?
>
> I wonder how many real females actually play the game.

The name was on my list, seemed to fit a bard, and sounded
female, so the character ended up female. Like I said, I
hadn't intended it to be my main character. If I had, I
probably would've done things much differently (I put 25
points into charisma so I could use the character to test
the range of prices too).

> I wonder how old players really are.

30

> I wonder where they live.

Boston

> I have the impression that many bards have real life interests and
> abilities in music. I do.

Playing piano since I was 7. Engineer by schooling though,
and engineers are a sort of jack of all trades. The ranger is
also considered the archetypical hybrid, and the druid is
supposed to be the swiss army knife of spellcasters (can heal,
can nuke, can buff, can debuff, can travel), and they were my
other top choices for characters. I guess I like playing jack
of all trades types.

> But I don't ask prying questions.
>
> You can't tell a lot from email, either. :-)}

Not very subtle either. :-)

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
